image.altText: Two pages on a desk showing a TasWater bill.

props.synopsis: Tasmanians are facing a nearly 40 per cent hike in their water bills over four years in what is being dubbed a "major blow" to those already struggling with the cost of living.

title.children: Tasmanian water bills could rise by almost 40pc over four years

image.altText: Two middle aged men in suits

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Liberals say Labor should concede the Tasmanian election, as both parties continue discussions with crossbenchers.

title.children: Liberals call on Labor to concede Tasmanian election

image.altText: Louise Elliot looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Hobart City councillor Louise Elliot wants to move Acknowledgement of Country and Welcome to Country protocols from official proceedings, arguing they are akin to religious rituals and being forced on people "against their will".

title.children: 'Fed up': Hobart councillor's push to move Acknowledgement of Country

image.altText: A gentleman in a maroon blazer and glasses holds a rolled up building plan outside of a rectangular grey building.

props.synopsis: Developer Errol Stewart has released plans for more than $100 million of projects in Tasmania, including a beachside hotel in Burnie near penguin habitat and a conference centre in Launceston.

title.children: Hotel proposed as part of developer's vision already attracting opposition

image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: Special legislation to fast-track the approval process for Hobart's proposed AFL stadium could be overtaken by the original Project of State Significance process, as the snap election interrupts voting timelines.

title.children: Delay on Hobart stadium reopens door for planning commission process

image.altText: Man in suit walks, clapping hands, followed by family, surrounded by crowd and media

props.synopsis: After four elections in seven years, calls are mounting for fixed four-year terms to be introduced in the Tasmanian parliament. But not everyone believes it would resolve the state's political instability.

title.children: Voters are frustrated by early elections. Would fixed terms work in Tasmania?

image.altText: An emaciated teenage boy lying in a hospital bed with his mother by his side.

props.synopsis: In a ward of Gaza City's Shifa Hospital, multiple children and some adults can be found emaciated from the lack of food. Doctors say the rate of death from starvation is rapidly rising.

title.children: Weighing just 10kg at 14 years old: 'Major starvation' takes hold in Gaza

image.altText: David Littleproud press conference with National Party leadership - 2025-05-20 13:03:02

props.synopsis: Australia has lifted the remaining biosecurity restrictions on US beef in a move the government could use to negotiate the removal of trade tariffs. Follow live.

title.children: Coalition questions if US beef decision designed to appease Trump

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Farrell says US trade chief didn't raise beef with him in meetings just weeks ago
Littleproud questions if US beef decision was 'traded away to appease Trump'
Cattle Australia 'comfortable' with decision on US beef

image.altText: Donald Trump, Melania Knauss, Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell pose for a photograph in a party

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump was allegedly told his name was in the Epstein files multiple times, according to senior administration officials who spoke to The Wall Street Journal.

title.children: Trump reportedly told his name in Epstein files

image.altText: Tesla logo and decreasing stock graph

props.synopsis: Electric vehicle maker Tesla misses expectations with its quarterly results, which analysts are labelling disappointing. The local share market has turned negative in early trade. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Tesla revenue slumps in sharpest fall in a decade

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Fortescue shares surge on positive production report
Aussie dollar pulls back from eight-month high

image.altText: A red Australia Post electric sign

props.synopsis: A superannuation fund does not know how many members have been impacted after mail was stolen from Australia Post in Melbourne's CBD.

title.children: Security breach at super fund after Australia Post mail theft

image.altText: A child sits on a wall with a bike nearby

props.synopsis: A new report from Victoria Legal Aid reveals a rise in the number of children being placed on violence intervention orders, with some as young as 10 years old.

title.children: 'How does this help?': Families fight intervention orders forced on their child

image.altText: aerial view of cleared land at a proposed mine site.

props.synopsis: The mining company has defended its actions at the proposed Gemini mine site in central Queensland, and says work has been done in accordance with state and federal laws.

title.children: Mining company allegedly begins clearing land for unapproved mine

image.altText: Kids toys on the floor.

props.synopsis: Fill-in childcare workers won't be included in the first stage of Victoria's new childcare worker registration scheme when it begins next month.

title.children: Fill-in workers excluded in first stage of Victorian childcare registration scheme

image.altText: Rows of babies in cardboard boxes strapped into the seats of a commercial aeroplane.

props.synopsis: In the closing weeks of the Vietnam War, hundreds of orphaned babies and children were airlifted to Australia for a new life, but not all of them were adopted.

title.children: In 1975, hundreds of babies were put in boxes and flown to Australia

image.altText: A close-up of Paul Keating's face as he looks up. He is indoors.

props.synopsis: The unusual decision, which came after years of negotiations, provides a rare glimpse into the ATO's inner workings when overturning its own decisions on tax debt.

title.children: ATO reverses decision to bill ex-PM's company $950k

image.altText: A crashed plane

props.synopsis: A lawyer says the return of victims' remains had been marred by serious errors, which had been identified following a probe by a British coroner.

title.children: Families of Air India crash victims receive wrong remains

image.altText: Illustration of lizard-like creatures, each with a striped crest made of long feather-like structures on its back.

props.synopsis: A strange crest found on ancient reptile fossils suggests birds and dinosaurs may not have the exclusive lock on feather-like features.

title.children: 'Wondrous reptile' fossil discovery deepens feather evolution puzzle

image.altText: A crowd of young people at Byron Bay's Beach hotel.

props.synopsis: NSW government plans to trial an "entertainment precinct" in Byron Bay are being hotly debated after a community-led meeting raised concerns about alcohol-fuelled violence.

title.children: Community concerns grow over Byron Bay entertainment precinct

image.altText: ATM blurred

props.synopsis: The move follows an ABC investigation which found ATM companies were cutting deals with tobacco criminals.

title.children: ABC investigation sparks removal of ATMs from suspected illegal tobacco stores

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day.

props.synopsis: There is new evidence that rental price growth is easing, potentially putting downward pressure on inflation and interest rates.

title.children: Economists predict interest rate relief as rent growth unexpectedly slows

image.altText: Shorthead seahorses found washed up at Hallett Cove.

props.synopsis: An independent group of marine scientists from around Australia releases a seven-point plan to tackle what it describes as South Australia's "catastrophic" toxic algal bloom.

title.children: Seven steps scientists say will tackle toxic algal bloom

image.altText: Bryan Kohberger dressed in orange jumpsuit in court is sentenced to life in prison

props.synopsis: Kohberger pleaded guilty in order to avoid the death penalty, and on sentencing, the judge acknowledged that the motive may never be known.

title.children: Bryan Kohberger sentenced to life in prison for murdering four Idaho students

image.altText: Emmanuel, in a blue suit, raises a hand to acknowledge photographers as Brigitte, in a white skirt suit, holds his arm.

props.synopsis: Candace Owens, a right-wing American podcaster, has repeatedly claimed the French president's wife used to be a man.

title.children: French president sues US influencer over claims his wife was born a man

image.altText: India batter Rishabh Pant leaves the field on a medical cart.

props.synopsis: Rishabh Pant's retirement through injury slows India's progress on day one of the fourth Test against England, with the tourists reaching stumps on 4-264.

title.children: India dealt blow with Pant's retirement against England in fourth Test

image.altText: Black and white still of a brunette man in a dark turtleneck reading from a storybook, humpty dumpty toy sitting behind him

props.synopsis: Donald Macdonald was many things over his 87 years, including a Play School host, a playwright, and a friend.

title.children: Remembering the 'gentle spirit' who hosted first seasons of Play School

image.altText: Aerial view of highway with a few residences pictured on the ground.

props.synopsis: A tourism business has lodged an appeal against a decision to approve a nearly billion-dollar energy storage project outside Broken Hill, saying light and noise will impact its business.

title.children: Outback stargazing business fights approval of $1b energy project

image.altText: A supermarket aisle

props.synopsis: Workers employed under the award system could not have penalty or overtime rates bargained away under new government legislation to be introduced today.

title.children: Labor seeks to legislate to protect penalty rates for award workers

image.altText: A close-up on a man's hand gripping the steering wheel. A mobile phone sits in its mount on the dashboard.

props.synopsis: Insurance company analysis shows lane departure warning and lane keeping assist are the least popular features.

title.children: Do you turn off driver assist tech in your vehicle? You're not alone

image.altText: Four women at the rugby union. wearing Australia Wallabies clothing

props.synopsis: With the Tom Richards Cup on the line, the Wallabies will be counting on the golden army turning out in Melbourne, where rugby union carved out its own slice of history 24 years ago.

title.children: Wallabies look for another golden moment in Melbourne against the Lions

image.altText: A close up of a smiling Matthew Perry, wearing clear plastic-rimmed glasses, a black suit jacked and a grey v-neck shirt.

props.synopsis: Dr Salvador Plasencia is charged with four counts of illegal distribution of the drug ketamine.

title.children: Doctor pleads guilty to supplying ketamine to Matthew Perry

image.altText: John Torode and Gregg Wallace sitting together at a table with a pile of saucepans on either side of them

props.synopsis: Two of the shows hosts were sacked by the broadcaster after a report into the program's internal culture.

title.children: BBC to air MasterChef UK series featuring sacked presenters

image.altText: Aitana Bonmatí celebrates affter scoring a goal for Spain against Germany in Euro 2025 semifinal.

props.synopsis: Spain's Aitana Bonmatí strikes a superb extra-time winner to fire her side to a 1-0 victory over Germany, sending the World Cup winners through to the Women's European Championship final for the first time.

title.children: Spain reaches Euro 2025 final after extra-time win over Germany

image.altText: Jonathan Milan crosses the finish line after winning stage 17 of the Tour de France.

props.synopsis: Jonathan Milan claims his second victory in this year's Tour de France when he won a crash-disrupted sprint in the 17th stage.

title.children: Italy's Milan wins Tour de France 17th stage, Pogačar retains yellow
